title: Shiloh National Military Park: Safety
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Safety            Safety         16th Wisconsin Color Bearers Memorial Stones NPS Photo  YOUR SAFETY IS OUR #1 CONCERN! Safety on Shiloh Battlefield:   * Drivers should watch for pedestrians and bicyclists, and observe posted speed limits * Pedestrians must walk on left side of roadways, facing traffic  * Do not climb on monuments, fences, cannon, or cemetery walls * Wildlife is protected within the park, please enjoy at a distance * Be aware of poisonous snakes, ticks, fire ants, wasps and bees on the park * Stay hydrated with water and/or sports drinks especially during the summer months * Be alert for possible severe weather, particularly for lightning and tornado alerts * Note that cell phone coverage is limited in some areas of the park   **In the event of an emergency dial 911**        To contact park staff call the Shiloh visitor center at 731-689-5696 from 8:00 am - 5:00 pm
